locutie.beschrijving: The sermon retells the narrative of Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego, focusing on their resistance to Babylonian indoctrination and their radical 'But if not' faith. It contextualizes this for graduates entering a 'pagan' American culture.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. The preacher focuses on the literary structure (repetition) and the theological core of the 'But if not' utterance, avoiding simple moralism.

illocutie.beschrijving: The sermon primarily functions as an ASSERTIVE narrative that shifts into a DIRECTIVE challenge for graduates, with a late-stage COMMISSIVE regarding God's presence in the 'fire'.
voorbeelden: I address you tonight as young American Christians.
The story gains its significance in each new generation.
Our God whom we serve is able to deliver us.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To instill a sense of 'vigilance' and 'discernment' in the graduates; to prepare them for suffering/resistance.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Moderate. The Spirit is mentioned in the closing blessing, but the sermon relies heavily on the 'power of the story' itself as the agent of change.

voorbeelden: Daniel 1-3 were young graduates like the men and women gathered before us today.
Old Testament poetry depends largely upon repetition.
The book of Daniel is part of the literature of martyrdom.
Listen carefully to the singular statement.
Will the members of the graduating class of 1988 please stand.
Practice righteousness, and show mercy to the oppressed.
I don’t know much about what it would be like...
I myself will confess to you that I do not find this so easy to listen to.
One cringes to think what the prophet Amos would say.
He alone keeps his promises in the way that is best for us.
He alone can and will vindicate the cause of his people.
May the Lord God of Hosts defend you.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Strong but delayed. The promises are concentrated in the final two paragraphs.

voorbeelden: I address you tonight as young American Christians.
In the name of the Father, and the Son, and of the Holy Spirit. AMEN.
declaratieven.autoriteit: The preacher speaks with the authority of a 'minister in a parish', but uses more narrative authority than sacramental authority.

indicatoren: Extensive retelling of the biblical plot (Locutionary surplus).
Academic analysis of literary devices (repetition, prose vs poetry).
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is well-informed and intellectually stimulated but remains an observer of the 'three young men' for the first 60% of the sermon.

missende_elementen: Immediate sacramental 'I' address from God to the hearer earlier in the text.
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The 'event' of the sermon is back-loaded, occurring primarily during the standing and the final blessing.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: High quality, though framed as a summary of God's character rather than a direct 'I promise you'.
voorbeelden: He alone keeps his promises in the way that is best for us.
He alone can and will vindicate the cause of his people.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Personal testimony and ministerial identification ('I am a minister').

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address to graduates, specifically in the 'temptation' list.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used to create a 'moment of decision' (Directive).

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing Daniel, the King, and the Babylonian culture.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a historical distance that is only bridged in the final third.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: General theological truths about God's nature.

actueel_present.gebruik: The 'standing' of the graduates and the final blessing.

foutief_patroon.probleem: The sermon avoids 'Assertive -> Directive' by grounding the call to stand in the 'But if not' nature of God (Commissives).

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Retelling (Assertive) -> The 'But if not' declaration (Declarative/Commissive) -> The call to vigilance (Directive) -> The final blessing (Declarative).
voorbeelden: The story... claims me by its power... calling you to march.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: The transition from the 'fiery furnace' to the 'standing graduates' is a powerful performative pivot.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Because God is worthy for his own sake (Indicative), you are going to be tempted... but stand (Imperative).

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: Despite a heavy constative start, the sermon successfully transitions into a performative event by using the biblical story as a 'claiming' power that addresses the graduates directly.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: Will the members of the graduating class of 1988 please stand.
sterke_punten.effect: Physically moves the hearers into the 'event' of the sermon.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The literary analysis of 'satraps, prefects, governors...'
zwakke_punten.probleem: Borderlines on a lecture about narrative art.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The sermon becomes an event when the preacher stops 'talking about' Daniel and starts 'claiming' the graduates for God's service.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The final blessing and the 'claiming' language evoke a sacramental encounter with the 'Most High God'.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Yes, God speaks through the 'claiming' power of the story.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Explicitly in the final blessing ('In the name of...').
tekstueel_bewijs: This story... goes out ahead of me, claiming me by its power.

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Implicitly. The 'supernatural power' that gripped the men is the focus.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Yes, the effect is left to the 'Lord God of Hosts' in the benediction.
tekstueel_bewijs: May the Lord God of Hosts defend you... and fill your hearts.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Yes, the sermon is treated as a means of 'defense' and 'peace'.
sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: The 'fourth man' in the fire is used as an epiphanic image of God's presence.
tekstueel_bewijs: He alone keeps his promises in the way that is best for us.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is verb-heavy in the past tense initially; it needs more present-tense commissives in the body.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The three young men believed that it was infinitely better to die...
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Tonight, God calls you to believe that it is better to die praising Him than to live for an idol.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from historical description to direct address.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promises are mostly about what God did for Daniel.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Incorporate the 'Fourth Man' (Christ) as a present promise for the graduates' own 'fires'.
voorbeeldzinnen: Christ promises to walk with you in the fires of Babylon.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: The 'standing' moment is an excellent use of address.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Maintain the 'But if not' as the indicative foundation.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in moving from narrative exegesis to performative proclamation.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: Unlike SvT, which would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' about liking the world, SAT focuses on the 'claiming power' of the Word as a divine act.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: It moves beyond persuasion (perlocution) to a formal act of commissioning (illocution).
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's power is not in the 'storytelling' but in the 'claiming' (Declarative) that happens at the end.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: I address you tonight as young American Christians.
kernzinnen_analyse.illocutionaire_kracht: Establishing the relationship and the moment.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'But if not' as a performative anchor that prevents the sermon from becoming a simple 'success story'.
